revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=December 2016}} {{Infobox person |birth_name = Thomas Loren Lenk |image = Tom Lenk13.jpg |caption=Lenk speaking at the 2013 WonderCon at the Anaheim Convention Center in Anaheim, California |birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1976|06|16}} |birth_place = [[Camarillo, California]], [[United States|U.S.]] |occupation = Actor |yearsactive = 1997–present }} '''Thomas Loren Lenk''' (born June 16, 1976) is an American stage and television actor best known for starring as [[Andrew Wells]] in the television series ''[[Buffy the Vampire Slayer (TV series)|Buffy the Vampire Slayer]]'' and its spin-off ''[[Angel (1999 TV series)|Angel]]''. ==Early life== Lenk was born in [[Camarillo, California]], the son of Pam Sherman, a teacher, and Fred Lenk, a tuba player, high school music teacher, and school district computer network administrator.{{cite web|url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/87/Tom-Lenk.html|title=Tom Lenk Biography (1976–)|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=Filmreference.com|deadurl=no|accessdate=October 23, 2013}} He attended [[Adolfo Camarillo High School]]. He graduated from the [[University of California, Los Angeles]] with a [[Bachelor of Arts]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.groundlings.com/performers/performer-details.aspx?performerID=615|title=Performers – Tom Lenk|last=|first=|date=|website=The Groundlings|dead-url=|access-date=2017-03-11}} ==Career== [[File:Buffy The Vampire Slayer cast.jpg|thumb|right|250px|(From left to right) Lenk, [[Emma Caulfield]], [[Alexis Denisof]], [[Alyson Hannigan]], [[Anthony Stewart Head]], [[Joss Whedon]], [[Michelle Trachtenberg]] at the ''Buffy'' cast party]] Lenk has appeared in episodes of ''Buffy the Vampire Slayer'' (27 episodes), ''[[Angel (1999 TV series)|Angel]]'',Prior to appearing as Andrew Wells, Lenk had a role as the vampire Cyrus in the season 5 episode "[[Real Me (Buffy the Vampire Slayer)|Real Me]]", [[NBC]]'s ''[[Joey (TV series)|Joey]]'', ''[[House (TV series)|House]]'', ''[[Six Feet Under (TV series)|Six Feet Under]]'', ''[[Eli Stone]]'' and ''[[How I Met Your Mother]]''. He had small parts in the films ''[[Date Movie]]'', ''[[The Number 23]]'', and ''[[Transformers (film)|Transformers]]''. Lenk appeared in the web series ''Border Patrol'',{{cite web|url=http://www.borderpatroltheshow.com/faq.html|title=Border Patrol|first=|date=|year=2010|website=|author=Greenbaum, Josh; McMillan, Ben|deadurl=no|accessdate=October 23, 2013}} which premiered in June 2008 on Atom.com. In 2009 Lenk appeared as a guest star on ''[[Nip/Tuck]].'' Besides acting, Lenk is a singer and playwright. He has toured with the European cast of ''[[Grease (musical)|Grease]]'' and has written three plays. Lenk took over the role of Franz in the Broadway musical ''[[Rock of Ages (musical)|Rock of Ages]]'' as of September 14, 2009, having originated the role in the Las Vegas and Los Angeles productions in 2006. From 2009 to 2010, Lenk posted video blogs of himself on [[YouTube]] summing up his experiences on Broadway, usually under the title "Tom's Broadway Blogs". Lenk also participates in video content with [[Felicia Day]]'s YouTube channel Geek and Sundry and parodies fashion on Instagram.{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/tommylenk/?hl=en|title=tommylenk|accessdate=February 16, 2017}} Lenk appeared in an episode of ''[[Psych]]'' that poked fun at ''Buffy the Vampire Slayer'' (original Buffy actress [[Kristy Swanson]] appears in the episode as well). He performed in the June 2012 edition of [[Don't Tell My Mother!]], a monthly showcase in which authors, screenwriters, actors and comedians share true stories they would never want their mothers to know.{{cite web|url=http://www.experiencela.com/calendar/event/47056|title=Calendar|accessdate=October 27, 2014}} In 2013, Lenk joined the [[Lifetime (TV network)|Lifetime]] series ''[[Witches of East End (TV series)|Witches of East End]]'' as Hudson Rafferty.{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/buffy-tom-lenk-lifetime-witches-east-end-379332|title='Buffy's' Tom Lenk Joins Lifetime's 'Witches of East End' (Exclusive)|last=Goldberg|first=Lesley|date=October 16, 2012|website=hollywoodreporter.com|publisher=Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=February 2, 2013}} In 2016, Lenk appeared in the third season finale of ''[[Transparent (TV series)|Transparent]]''.{{cite web|last1=VanArendonk|first1=Kathryn|title=Transparent Season-Finale Recap: To Shell and Back|url=http://www.vulture.com/2016/10/transparent-recap-season-3-episode-10.html|website=Vulture|publisher=New York Media|accessdate=October 15, 2016}} ==Personal life== Lenk is [[coming out|openly]] [[gay]].{{Cite news | title = Coming Out But Canceled | periodical = [[The Advocate]] | issue = 1019 | url = http://www.accessmylibrary.com/coms2/summary_0286-36361972_ITM | accessdate =February 23, 2009 | date = November 18, 2008 }} {{dead link|date=October 2013}}{{cite web | url = http://www.thebacklot.com/tom-lenk-aka-andrew-frombuffy-is-officially-out/10/2008/ | title = Tom Lenk, aka Andrew from"Buffy", is officially out! |deadurl=no |accessdate=October 23, 2013 | author = | last = Jensen | first = Michael | authorlink = | coauthors = | date = October 28, 2008 | year = | month = | work = Logo NewNowNext | publisher = | location = | pages = | language = | doi = | dateformat = | quote = }} ==Filmography== === Film === {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Year ! Film !
